Package jMidiSequencerBeta.view.gui

Class GuiView

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • jMidiSequencerBeta.view.gui.GuiView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.Observer, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants, ICompositionView
    public class GuiView
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements ICompositionView
    A frame for the Music Editor GUI. This frame will contain a scrollable display of the pitches in the provided composition, displayed vertically, all of the notes associated with those pitches displayed horizontally in a ledger based on their onset and offsets, and a ten octave keyboard below. A move-able red bar will also be displayed, and any notes selected by the bar will be illuminated by the keyboard.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getCursorPosition

        public int getCursorPosition()

        Returns:
        the position of the cursor.

      • setCursorPosition

        public void setCursorPosition​(int increase)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the cursor position by the desired amount, and repaints the JFrame to update the necessary JPanels, such as the keyboard view and the ledger view. If the desired increase would move the bar to a position lower than zero or greater than the maximum tick in the score, an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        increase - the desired change for the cursor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the change would cause the cursor value to become less than zero.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the change would cause the cursor value to become greater than the maximum tick in the composition.

      • setCursorAbsolutePosition

        public void setCursorAbsolutePosition​(int posn)
                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the cursor position to the desired posn, and repaints the JFrame to update the necessary JPanels, such as the keyboard view and the ledger view. If the desired increase would move the bar to a position lower than zero or greater than the maximum tick in the score, an exception is thrown.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the change would cause the cursor value to become less than zero.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the change would cause the cursor value to become greater than the maximum tick in the composition.

      • getKeyAtPosition

        public PianoKey getKeyAtPosition​(java.awt.Point point)
        Returns the PianoKey associated with the given Point. This allows for notes to be added based on the pitch of the selected key.
        Parameters:
        point - The point used to locate the selected PianoKey.
        Returns:
        the selected PianoKey.
